responses.rationale: Reports a low risk ('negligible') but lacks explicit calming language from the Q5 guard list or table patterns.
Contains 'peace of mind' but the speaker is not identified as an official body or the author, failing the Q5 guard.
Reports a negative fact ('risen rapidly') without any explicit calming cue.
Describes symptoms vividly but contains no explicit calming cue.
Reports a bare positive fact ('It didnâ€™t happen') without explicit calming language.
Reports a negative fact ('risen rapidly') without any explicit calming cue.
Contains bare negations/positive facts ('just is not infecting', 'not an issue') but lacks explicit calming language from the Q5 guard list.
Reports bare positive facts ('one-off', 'no close contacts had become sick') without explicit calming language from the Q5 guard list.
Describes a plan/capability without explicitly linking it to present public safety or using calming language.
Reports a fact without any explicit calming cue.
Contains a bare negation ('do not indicate a nationwide shortage') but lacks explicit calming language from the Q5 guard list.
Contains a comparative statement about worry level ('don't think the virus itself is necessarily any more worrying') but lacks explicit calming language from the Q5 guard list or table patterns.
Reports negative facts (deaths/culling) and uncertainty without any explicit calming cue.
'federal officials reiterated... that they believe the country can still eliminate' is a statement of confidence from an official source.
